description: Borrowed from Medieval Latin incriminatum, past participle of incrimino, from Latin in + crimino.

verbs.description: incriminate (third-person singular simple present incriminates, present participle incriminating, simple past and past participle incriminated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To accuse or bring criminal charges against.
examples: The newspapers incriminated the innocent man unjustly.
We have all sorts of evidence which incriminates you.
